Pneumonia is an inflammatory condition of the lung that can be caused by various pathogens, including viruses, bacteria (both Gram-positive and Gram-negative), fungi, and other microorganisms. A Gram-negative bacterial infection is just one possible cause of pneumonia, not equivalent to pneumonia itself.
